title: Warmer weather hits profits at British Gas owner

title: Reeves fixated on 'dysfunctional' borrowing rules, says IFS
partialText: The think tank suggests the chancellor's fiscal rules need to shift the focus from one key figure.

title: Why there's no quick fix in sight for the problem of dazzling headlights
partialText: Road users say headlight glare is an issue - but experts warn a solution might not be straightforward.

title: 'We're still on edge': Toy firms look to US Supreme Court as tariffs hit profits
partialText: "You cannot go to sleep on this president," says one toymaker, of the ongoing uncertainty over trade policy.

title: Etsy sells second-hand fashion app Depop to eBay for $1.2bn
partialText: The "pre-loved" fashion firm has been sold by Etsy just five years after it bought the firm.

title: The two farms in Senegal that supply many of the UK's vegetables
partialText: During winter in Britain fresh produce is sent by cargo ship from the West African nation every week.

title: Zuckerberg defends Meta in landmark social media addiction trial

title: Tech firms will have 48 hours to remove abusive images under new law
partialText: The government is proposing that intimate image abuse should be treated more severely.

title: Bill Gates pulls out of India's AI summit over Epstein files controversy
partialText: The Gates Foundation said the decision was made to "ensure the focus remains on the summit's key priorities".

title: Dennis the Menace featured on 50p coin to mark 75 years
partialText: The new coin has been made with with Beano, Britain's longest-running weekly comic, first published in 1938

title: Pubs to open late for home nations  World Cup knockout games
partialText: Football fans will be able to enjoy an extra round at the pub thanks to new rules during the men's World Cup.

title: Trump adviser calls for Fed economists to be 'disciplined'

title: Lower fuel prices and airfares help drive inflation down
partialText: The rate at which prices are rising is slowing down, which could lead to lower interest rates.

title: Plan to increase youth minimum wage could be delayed
partialText: Government sources tell BBC News they could slow down plans to make minimum wage equal across age groups.

title: Illegal skin lightening cream being sold in UK butchers, watchdog warns

title: 'Check your payslip' warns nurse who overpaid nearly £3k in tax

title: 'I do not trust them' - top streamers left concerned by Discord age checks

title: 'The search is soul-destroying': Young jobseekers on the struggle to find work

title: I invested £12,000 in Brewdog  - I think I've lost it all

title: Calculator: How will freeze on tax thresholds hit your take-home pay?

title: Royal Mail given two weeks to respond to claims it is prioritising parcels
